D.O. | DOH KYUNGSOO

A South Korean singer/songwriter and actor.

Doh Kyung-soo, also known by his stage name D.O., is first known as a member and one of the main vocalists of the South Korean boy group EXO. Apart from his group's activities, D.O. has also starred in various television dramas and movies.

D.O is well known for his sweet and clean vocals but he also received immense praises and public admiration when he started acting from the 2014 drama "It's Okay, That's Love" and the movie "Cart".

A Look into D.O's Life

  • born on January 12, 1993 in Goyang, Gyeonggi Province, South Korea.
  • formally introduced as the eighth member of Exo on January 30, 2012.
  • made his acting debut with a supporting role in the movie Cart in September 2014.
  • made his small screen debut playing a supporting role in the SBS drama It's Okay, That's Love
  • In February 2016, he collaborated with Yoo Young-jin on a duet titled "Tell Me (What Is Love)" for SM Station.
  • In 2018, D.O. starred in Swing Kids, a film set in a prison camp in South Korea during the Korean War. He plays a North Korean soldier who falls in love with tap dancing in the midst of all the chaos.
  • In May 2019, D.O. was awarded V Live Popularity Award at the 55th Baeksang Arts Awards.
  • He enlisted as an active duty soldier on July 1, 2019, and served at the Capital Mechanized Infantry Division (Fierce Tiger Division) as a food handler (kitchen police).
  • On the same day, he released the single "That's Okay", a song that he co-wrote, through the SM Station project.
  • D.O. was discharged from the military on January 25, 2021.
  • His first extended play Empathy was released on July 26, along with its lead single "Rose".

Want to know more about D.O.? You may check his Wikipedia entry here.
